meta.description: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club at Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL), Concourse A. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club

location.terminalDirections: Take escalators up to the Upper Level near Gate A19, next to P.F. Chang's.

lounge.description: The Delta Sky Club is an award-winning retreat that allows relaxation, productivity, or both.

reviews.content: Arr. 10a+ Sat in time toward end of breakfast, transition to lunch fare b/w ~10:30/45-11a; they’d run out of bagels, no ketchup for egg/cheese omelettes; fairly spacious accommodations for the hour +.
This lounge is an exercise in claustrophobia and overpopulation. How I long for the Virgin lounge in Amsterdam. The Wi-Fi is difficult to get on; probably due to the hoards using it. Gah.
Comfortable and quiet but the staff was rude and bathroom was disgusting.
Much better than the other A Terminal Lounge.
6:30a. Food was like last reviewer stated. No protein except eggs. Tables are set up too close to food area so it creates congestion right there.
Old, overcrowded, with a massive line at the bar even to get a glass of water or a soft drink, which you could easily get yourself from a fridge.
Plenty of seating at 6:40am. Breakfast options consisted of tasty eggs, bagels, fruit, hard boiled eggs and granola.
Most of these reviews are very dated. I was there 8-15-18 and found it very comfortable, friendly service, clean (including bathrooms - Men’s). Food was okay but could be stepped up.
I am here at 6:30PM, and the food items are running out.
OK lounge but pathetic food selection. Come on Delta. For what you charge this is terrible.
Lounge is clean, and bar is fine. But it has the worst selection of food ever. 6 hard boiled eggs that have been picked over and a few bagels in the entire hour I was there. Sad.
Lounge is looking dated now, especially after all the updates at ATL. I'm here at 06:30am and fairly poor breakfast selection compared to other Delta clubs. Limited power and few comfy seats.
Probably the least good food in ATL.
Best Delta Lounge in ATL after the international and Terminal E.
Nothing special, but OK place to spend 1-2h.
The better of the two A terminal Sky Clubs. Nice decor and more spacious. Perhaps because it's harder to find, it's not always packed like the others. Good apron views.
Several areas to relax and work . Good variety of food and drinks. Staff were helpful and courteous. Bathrooms could use some updating.
Good sized lounge. A bit busy. Wasn't very stocked with amenities when I was here. A nice lounge nonetheless.
Large club with a great staff. My favorite club in ATL! Worth a visit.
Lounge was fine. Bathroom was undersized, dirty, and dilapidated.
This lounge was way better than the Delta Sky Club I visited in the B Terminal first.
